author: Staff Reporter
text:
Krithiga Ravichandran to receive award today at the Rashtrapati Bhavan

Twenty-five-year-old Bharatanatyam dancer Krithiga Ravichandran of Puducherry is one of the 100 top women achievers of India. She will receive an award at the Rashtrapati Bhavan on January 22.

Ministry of Women and Child Development, Government of India, New Delhi, in collaboration with Facebook had launched #100 Women Initiative last year to recognize and acknowledge women who are making a difference in their communities.

The #100 women initiative involves a contest to select 100 women achievers of India through public nominations via social media.

Her dream

A resident of Lawspet, she started practising dance from the age of five. Working as an assistant professor in Computer Science in Rajiv Gandhi Arts and Science College, her dream is to incorporate technology in performance. “I want to do an interactive stage performance of two artistes using skype. I will perform this within five years,” she says with confidence.

She is the founder of a trust called Veer Foundation of Arts and Culture, for the development and growth of arts and culture.

She also works with other non-governmental organizations (NGOs) such as Mughil Educational Trust, Amma Samuga Seva Maiyam etc., performing free stage programmes as part of fund-raising campaign.

She has recently taken up a challenging task of choreographing Tirukkural , for the entire 1330 couplets.
